docs.lead_paragraph: For Duncan Irving's LIVE updates of the second-round/round of 16/Octaviofinal match between the US U20s and Uruguay from Toronto, click "read more."
docs.abstract: On the soccer front, the U.S. advances, but they've picked up a few troublesome cards -- Adu's and Bradley's may come back to haunt them. And there's that injury to Altidore. But with a match to come against Austria in the quarterfinal, they won't have a better shot at reaching the final four.

docs.snippet: Michael Bradley scored in the 107th minute, and the United States rallied past Uruguay, 2-1, last night to advance to the quarterfinals of the FIFA Under-20 World Cup in Toronto.
docs.lead_paragraph: Michael Bradley scored in the 107th minute, and the United States rallied past Uruguay, 2-1, last night to advance to the quarterfinals of the FIFA Under-20 World Cup in Toronto.

headline.main: U.S. Team, Led by Lilly, Will Lean on Rookies

docs.snippet: Last night's Argentina-Mexico Copa América semifinal drew 798,000 viewers between 8:30 and 10:45 p.m. according to Nielsen People Meter figures -- making it the most watched program of any kind, in any language, in the New York area.
docs.lead_paragraph: Univision, Telefutura and Galavisión continue to do extremely well with their soccer telecasts this summer. After running up big numbers recently with the Gold Cup, Univision and the two other Spanish-language television networks it owns have split among them telecasts of the Copa América and the FIFA U-20 World Cup. In New York especially, they have registered some astonishingly high numbers.
docs.abstract: Last night's Argentina-Mexico Copa América semifinal drew 798,000 viewers between 8:30 and 10:45 p.m. according to Nielsen People Meter figures -- making it the most watched program of any kind, in any language, in the New York area.

headline.main: The New New York, Watching Soccer on TV

docs.snippet: The Copa América is hurtling toward its unspeakable climax, the Argentina-Brazil tournament final in Maracaibo on Sunday. Today is our last chance to catch up with various news, notes and other stories that have emerged since it all began on June...

docs.snippet: The award for the Copa América's best player -- three of the top nominees have to be Robinho of Brazil, Juan Román Riquelme of Argentina, and Nery Castillo of Mexico. Who would you add to the list of nominees?
docs.lead_paragraph: The Copa América is down to two teams now, and it really is time to think about who deserves to be chosen best player of the tournament. We asked this of you after the quarterfinals, suggesting that the top three nominees had to be Robinho of Brazil, Juan Román Riquelme of Argentina, and Nery Castillo of Mexico.
